page.title: 11WOOLHOPE RELIGION (1)
page.content: {St. George's Anglican Church } The churchyard has a 17th C lych-gate (the Skallenge), a fine plague cross restored for Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee & a 500 year old iron scutcheon plate on the door. Inside is an ancient holy water stoup. A round Norman arch shows dog tooth moulding on the capital. The North side is 14th century with barrel roof and some Jacobean panelling. Three old coffin lids are displayed. A window shows Lady Godiva & her sister Wulviva who gave the manor of Woolhope to Hereford Cathedral in the 11th C. A smaller pane shows Lady Godiva on a white horse. The 13th C tower has just undergone restoration & houses six bells, one medieval with a prayer to St. John inscribed. There is a team of bellringers. The communion plate has been in use for 300 years.
